III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth at the facility is on 10-minute checks due to being a high
risk for AWOL. On 5/25/25, the youth went outside to throw away
the trash in the dumpster up the driveway. The youth asked a staff
member to go outside and stated they would return before the
next check-in. The youth did not return and was reported as a
runaway. Staff also allowed the youth to use the phone without
being monitored which allowed her to set up her AWOL plan.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 29,
2025. Youth A reported the staff are always watching what she is
doing. She reported Staff 1 did allow her to use the phone with no
restrictions. Youth A reported when she was doing her chore of
taking out the trash, she planned to AWOL.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on May 30, 2025. Staff 1
reported on May 24, 2025, he was working with Staff 2. He
reported Youth A had just been taken off one-to-one supervision
the day prior and was on five-minute checks when in her bedroom
and ten-minute checks when outside her bedroom. Staff 1
reported he oversaw those checks and was completing them
correctly. He reported Youth A had asked to use the phone to call
her family member and Staff 1 allowed her to do so. Staff 1
reported he was unaware of the phone restrictions Youth A was
on and stated this was in an email that he did not read. He
reported after Youth A’s phone call, she had asked to take out the
trash which he allowed as it is part of the house chores. Staff 1
reported when he went to check on Youth A outside, she was no
longer there, and he then followed AWOL protocol. He reported he
takes responsibility for not knowing about the phone call
restrictions and feels horrible about the situation. Staff 1 stated in
the future he would like there to be more verbal communication
between shift changes about safety precautions for the youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on May 29,
2025. Staff 2 reported Saturday, May 24, 2025, was his first shift
after coming off orientation status. He reported he was just
2

working with Staff 1 on that day. Staff 2 reported Youth A had
been removed off one-to-one supervision the day prior and was
on increased safety checks of ten and five minutes. He reported
with Youth A coming off one-to-one supervision there was
confusion if that meant she was still on phone restrictions as
well. Staff 2 reported Youth A did make a phone call that day and
neither he nor Staff 1 held the phone for Youth A during that
phone call. He confirmed Staff 1 did complete a safety check and
then allowed Youth A to take out the trash outside which is a part
of her chore in the house. Staff 2 reported when Staff 1 went to
check on Youth A outside she was gone, and the police were
called for an AWOL report.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on May
29, 2025. Therapist reported Youth A was taken off one-to-one
supervision status on May 23, 2025. She reported Youth A was
placed on ten-minute observation checks when outside of her
bedroom and five-minute observation checks when inside her
bedroom after being taken off one-to-one supervision. Therapist
reported Youth A was allowed to go outside on her own to take
out the trash as this was her chore at the facility. She reported
Staff 1 was following that part of Youth A’s supervision plan.
Therapist reported Youth A though was also placed on a
restriction where staff needed to hold the phone and supervise her
phone calls. She reported Staff 1 did not follow that part of Youth
A’s supervision plan as he allowed her to have full access to the
phone on May 24, 2025.
Supervisor was interviewed via phone on May 29, 2025.
Supervisor reported she spoke with Staff 1 after the AWOL
incident occurred and he took full responsibility for allowing Youth
A to have full access to the phone. She reported Staff 1 stated
that he did not read his email and was unaware of the phone
restriction. Supervisor confirmed Staff 1 followed Youth A’s safety
checks.
Documents Reviewed:
- Youth A’s Safety Plan dated 05/23/2025- This safety plan
notes Youth A demonstrated unsafe behavior on the phone
on 05/17/2025, therefore, continuation of previous provision
to have staff hold and dial phone. The safety plan notes 1-1
can be discontinued. Youth A will be on 10-minute checks
on all shifts and 5-mintue checks while in their bedroom on
all shifts. Youth A is not permitted to hold the house phone
as staff will dial and hold the phone for Youth A.
3

- Youth A’s Safety Checks dated 05/24/2025- Safety
checks of Youth A were completed by Staff 1 and were
following her safety plan of five-to-ten-minute checks. The
safety checks note Youth A went AWOL at 2145.
- Facility Safety and Supervision Policy- Within this policy
it notes that staff are expected to read all clinical
precautions orders/safety plan at the start of their shift and
follow those guidelines.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File and Training record-
Staff 1 has no disciplinary actions noted within his human
resource file. Staff 1 is up to date on all training
requirements including Maple Lodge Orientation on
02/06/2025 and role of direct care staff on 03/20/2025.
Analysis Facility was found in non-compliance of Staff 1 not following the
facility’s supervision policy. Within the interviews with Staff 1, Staff
2, and Youth A it was found that Staff 1 allowed Youth A to hold
the home phone and make her own phone calls unsupervised
which is against Youth A’s safety plan. Staff 1 admitted to not
reviewing Youth A’s precaution orders prior to his shift which is
noted in the supervision policy.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2025SIC0000546 dated 05/28/2025, CAP approved 06/16/25
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
